question:
Some people claim that not enough of the waste from homes is recycled. They say that the only way to increase recycling is for governments to make it a legal requirement. 
To what extent do you think laws are needed to make people recycle more of their waste?
text: It is considered by some that home misuse is not adequately recycled, they believe that the only method to increase recycling of waste is by following power rules and regulations.  In my opinion, I agree that authority laws and regulations are needed for society to recycle more of their waste products.

On the one hand, state law is the only way to put the population into the order of recycling  their waste component . This is because we live in consumer lives, in which family think  that your hierarchy in  society depends on the number of items discarded and the number of new households bought.  As a result, they tend to discard old feature into a bin which later pollutes the environment in one way or the other. Thus, with union law guiding the amount of misuse discarded per  household on a weekly or monthly ,basis this would reduce the number of items discarded and increased the level of component recycling .

On the other hand, it is also considered that with government law guiding recycling of home items,it can also make the environment safer to live in for the people. This is because this would reduce the amount of littering items in  society and make it a safe place.  As a result, the community would breathe in fresh and not contaminated air and  live a more healthy life. For example, many studies have shown that the major causes of air pollution are by disposing of waste products.  Therefore, this can be prevented by government laws  protecting the surroundings and preventing inappropriate discard of waste products.
In conclusion, I believe that government rules are the best way to guide and make recycling mandatory  for people rather than discarding it inappropriately which can be caused a health hazard.
